title: Course on Applying Gamification to Mathematics Education Technology

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Learners engage in gamification elements using personal devices (BYOD) and develop real-world problem-solving skills through project implementation. Assessment focuses on summative evaluation

learning_goals: Learners can enhance motivation for solving mathematical problems by over 80% using gamification tools (e.g., quiz platforms, virtual reward systems).
Learners can apply mathematical thinking by completing three or more practical projects in a PBL environment.
Learners can collaborate with peers via digital platforms and complete five or more feedback cycles.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
